title: Update: Teen Shot Self, LR Police Say
content:
Update:
LITTLE ROCK, Ark. - A local teen has admitted the gunshot wound he suffered outside a local apartment complex Sunday night was self-inflicted.
That's according to the incident report released Monday morning by the Little Rock Police Department (LRPD).
The 16-year-old boy was found wounded shortly after 7 p.m. on a sidewalk at the Pleasant Valley Pointe complex on Pleasant Ridge Road.
The boy first told officers he had been on the sidewalk looking down at his cell phone when a vehicle drove up and someone inside started shooting at him.
He was taken to Arkansas Children's Hospital for treatment of a wound to the shoulder.
Police say the teen later admitted shooting himself and firing additional rounds into the ground to make it look like someone else had shot him.
The reports states that the teen told detectives where to find the weapon and the LRPD says they confiscated a .22 caliber revolver.
Original story:
LITTLE ROCK, Ark. -- Police are investigating after a shooting at the Pleasant Valley Pointe apartments in west Little Rock.
According to police, a male juvenile was shot once in the shoulder.
They say his injury is not life-threatening.
Police say it is unclear if the shooting happened at the apartment complex on Pleasant Ridge Road or if the juvenile ran there for help.
No suspect description has been released.
